meanings.definition: A small hill or mound of earth.
meanings.sent1: From the top of the knoll, you could see the entire valley.
meanings.sent2: Children love rolling down the grassy knoll in the park.
meanings.sent3: The ants worked together to build a tiny knoll out of sand.
meanings.sent4: The knoll looked like a giant sleeping turtle in the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun cast a warm glow over the peaceful knoll.

meanings.definition: To ring a bell in a slow, solemn manner.
meanings.sent1: The church bells knoll softly during the evening prayer.
meanings.sent2: The old clock tower used to knoll every hour.
meanings.sent3: The doorbell seemed to knoll a cheerful tune.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the bell knolling echoed through the empty streets.
meanings.sent5: The knolling of the bell signaled the end of the ceremony.
